statement:
In any triangle, the orthocenter $H$, the centroid $G$ and the
circumcenter $O$ are collinear, and $OG/GH=1/2$. The line passing by
these points is known as the *Euler line* of the triangle.

This line also passes by the center of the nine-point circle (or
Feuerbach circle) $N$, and $N$ is the midpoint of $OH$.
